Class Account

java.lang.Object
net.tangly.erp.ledger.domain.Account
All Implemented Interfaces:
net.tangly.core.HasId, net.tangly.core.HasName
public class Account extends Object implements net.tangly.core.HasId, net.tangly.core.HasName
Defines an account as seen for double entry booking ledger and legal accounting for tax ports. { id = 1, kind = ASSET, description = "Assets"}

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    Account.AccountGroup
    Defines to which group the account belongs: assets, liabilities, expenses, or profits and losses.
    static enum 
    Account.AccountKind
    Defines the kind of the account: asset, liability, income, expense, or an aggregate one.

    • balance

      public BigDecimal balance(@NotNull @NotNull LocalDate date)
      Debits and Credits are from the bank’s point of view, and so are the opposite of what you expect when it comes to the maths involved. Debits - meaning assets and expenses - have a positive balance, and Credits - meaning liabilities and income - have a negative balance.
      • If I Debit (add to) a Debit account, it gets more positive and has a larger format (Debit -> Soll)
      • If I Credit (subtract from) a Debit account, it gets less positive and has a smaller format (Credit -> Haben)
      • If I Debit (add to) a Credit account, it gets less negative and has a smaller format
      • If I Credit (subtract from) a Credit account, it gets more negative and has a larger format
      Parameters:
      date - date at which the balance is computed
      Returns:
      the balance of the account at the requested date

    • balance

      public BigDecimal balance(@NotNull @NotNull LocalDate from, @NotNull @NotNull LocalDate to)
      Returns the balance of the account between two dates. The balance is computed by summing the booking entries between the two dates.
      Parameters:
      from - start date
      to - end date
      Returns:
      the balance of the account between the two dates
